## Table of Contents

### Plans

* [`cd4pe_plans::promote_modules`](#cd4pe_planspromote_modules): This plan will promote a list of modules to a specified stage.

## Plans

### <a name="cd4pe_planspromote_modules"></a>`cd4pe_plans::promote_modules`

This plan will promote a list of modules to a specified stage.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cd4pe_plans::promote_modules` plan:

* [`modules`](#modules)
* [`workspace`](#workspace)
* [`branch`](#branch)
* [`commit_sha`](#commit_sha)
* [`stage`](#stage)
* [`cd4pe_host`](#cd4pe_host)
* [`cd4pe_email`](#cd4pe_email)
* [`cd4pe_password`](#cd4pe_password)
* [`targets`](#targets)

##### <a name="modules"></a>`modules`

Data type: `Array[String[1]]`

The array of modules to promote

##### <a name="workspace"></a>`workspace`

Data type: `String[1]`

The workspace the pipelines live in

##### <a name="branch"></a>`branch`

Data type: `String[1]`

The branch the pipeline triggers on

Default value: `'master'`

##### <a name="commit_sha"></a>`commit_sha`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If left empty, the commit of the last pipeline run will be promoted. If specified, that commit (or branch reference) will be promoted. Obviously, specifying the same commit hash (instead a branch) for multiple modules doesn't really make sense.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="stage"></a>`stage`

Data type: `String[1]`

The stage to promote to

##### <a name="cd4pe_host"></a>`cd4pe_host`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The host running the CD4PE application

Default value: `$targets`

##### <a name="cd4pe_email"></a>`cd4pe_email`

Data type: `String[1]`

The email address of the CD4PE user

##### <a name="cd4pe_password"></a>`cd4pe_password`

Data type: `Sensitive[String[1]]`

The CD4PE user password

##### <a name="targets"></a>`targets`

Data type: `TargetSpec`

The node to run the task on
